yoruba: Má tẹ̀ẹ́ lọ́wọ́ oníle, má tẹ̀ẹ́ lọ́wọ́ àlejò; lọ́wọ́ ara ẹni la ti ńtẹ́.
gold: Save face with members of your household and save face with complete strangers, such a person loses face with himself/herself.
gen:
The Yoruba proverb "Má tẹ̀ẹ́ lọ́wọ́ oníle, má tẹ̀ẹ́ lọ́wọ́ àlejò; lọ́wọ́ ara ẹni la ti ńtẹ́" translates to "Do not rely on the host, do not rely on the guest; it is one's own hand that one relies on."

Explanation:
This proverb emphasizes the importance of self-reliance and independence. It advises against depending too much on others, whether they are familiar (the host) or unfamiliar (the guest). Instead, it suggests that one should rely on their own abilities and resources. The proverb teaches the value of self-sufficiency and encourages individuals to take responsibility for their own well-being and success.
